poem:
Title: "Of Austerity and Alms"

In the limpid halls of power,  
Avarice hints at a chilling dowry.  
Hunt, in his walled ivory tower,  
Plays the actor, shrewd and sorry.  

Vows of tax cuts, a siren's song,  
Ruthless privation behind his smile.  
Rigid cuts veiled in a cheerstrong throng,  
British lapwing, are we beguiled?  

Our patrimony, to leverage elections
O, calculating political selections!
